result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:31 PM Defendant Maria Gerarda Ruacho-Martinez in court.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Maria Gerarda Ruacho-Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Robert Jambois in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Waiver form is handed to Court.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:47 PM Defendant Maria Gerarda Ruacho-Martinez in court.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Maria Gerarda Ruacho-Martinez.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF263. and 22CT110.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held on 22CF263.
Atty Kaupie would enter not guilty pleas on 22CT110.

BY THE COURT: 
Not guilty pleas are accepted on 22CT110.

Atty Kaupie would request a PTC be set for the 22CF263 on 09/12/22.
ADA Mutchler would indicate that a preliminary hearing needs to be held prior to the PTC.
Court makes statements.
Court questions what problems may be created if this is set for a PTC first and then the PH is held.
ADA Mutchler informs the court of the standard procedure on felony matters.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued on both cases.
PH to be set for 22CF263 on 10/03/22
PTC to be set for 22CT110 on 09/12/22.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm. for 22CF263
